action.action-desc: Mr. Hudson (for himself and Mr. Allred) introduced the following bill
Referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to encourage programs to address college athlete mental health.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Targeting Emotional and Mental Stability Act of 2023.
Section 520E–2 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290bb–36b) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), by adding at the end the following:
Carrying out one or more school-based programs to address mental health disorders among the college athlete population, including providing access to—

subparagraph.text: mental health care services for college athletes, including real-time counseling and telehealth services;
existing crisis lifeline services, including the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline;
training for students, faculty, athletic coaches, and staff to respond effectively to students exhibiting signs of mental distress or substance use disorder; or
campus-wide education initiatives to address the stigma associated with mental health issues among college athletes.

paragraph.text: in subsection (d), by adding at the end the following:

For an institution of higher education proposing to use the grant for an activity described in paragraph (13) of subsection (b), a letter of support from the athletics department of the institution of higher education.
